intro: Goeppertia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage. The leaves are typically broad and have a velvety texture, with intricate patterns that change color depending on light conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. This plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
